title: SEC is Likely to Approve Ethereum ETF in May, Standard Chartered Predicts (ETH) - Bloomberg
summary: According to a Bloomberg report, the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is likely to approve an exchange-traded fund (ETF) that holds Ethereum in May, as predicted by Standard Chartered Plc. The SEC has until May 23 to consider ETF applications from VanEck and Ark 21Shares, which will be the first to face the final deadline. If approved, this would mark a significant development in the cryptocurrency market as it would provide a more traditional investment vehicle for institutional investors to gain exposure to Ethereum.

title: 3 Cryptos to Buy Before the Coming Ethereum Upgrade - Yahoo Finance
summary:
The article discusses the upcoming Ethereum upgrade, Deneb/Cancun, and how it could significantly impact the Ethereum ecosystem. The author suggests that this upgrade could lead to increased adoption of Ethereum-based Web 3.0 projects, and highlights three cryptocurrencies that could benefit from this trend: Ethereum (ETH), Optimism (OP), and 0xGasless (0XGAS).

The author argues that Ethereum has the most to gain from the upgrade, as it aims to solve the network's nagging fee issues and improve layer-2 efficiency. However, the author also notes that the upgrade could lead to increased competition for Ethereum from other layer-2 scaling solutions, such as Solana (SOL) and Avalanche (AVAX).

The article also highlights Optimism and 0xGasless as promising investment opportunities. Optimism is a leading layer-2 scaling solution that utilizes optimistic rollups for Ethereum, while 0xGasless is focused on eliminating gas fees and expanding Ethereum's addressable

title: SEC likely to approve spot Ethereum ETFs on May 23: Standard Chartered - The Block
summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is likely to approve spot Ethereum exchange-traded funds (ETFs) on May 23, according to Standard Chartered Bank. The bank's head of forex and digital assets research, Geoffrey Kendrick, expects the SEC to follow the same approach as with spot bitcoin ETFs, starting with rejections and ultimately granting approval on the final deadline. Kendrick believes that the SEC has not categorized ether as a security in its legal actions against crypto companies, and the listing of ETH as a regulated futures contract on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange adds weight to this expectation. He also notes that Grayscale's Ethereum trust could be turned into an ETF, and that there is no fundamental reason for the SEC to view ETH differently than the CME does. Kendrick has an optimistic outlook on crypto, predicting that the price of bitcoin could rise to $100,000 by the end of the year and $200,000 by the end of 2025, and that expected in

title: Standard Chartered Predicts Ethereum (ETH) Price Will Hit $4,000 Following ETF Approval - U.Today
summary: Standard Chartered predicts that the price of Ethereum (ETH) will reach $4,000 following the approval of ETFs by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). However, the prediction is met with varying opinions from analysts, with some expressing skepticism over the SEC's decision. Legal experts Jake Chervinsky and Scott Johnsson have pointed out that the SEC may demand consistent correlation across a 2.5-year sample period, which could pose regulatory hurdles. JPMorgan and Bloomberg Intelligence also offer cautious predictions, with a 50% and 70% chance of approval, respectively. The current trading price of Ethereum stands at around $2,372.37, with a market cap nearing $285 billion. Despite this, the Ethereum Fear and Greed Index indicates a neutral market sentiment, with a current score of 54.

title: Big Geth users are diversifying their clients following Nethermind bug - Blockworks
summary: The recent Nethermind bug in Ethereum's client software has raised concerns about client centralization, as a majority of validators (84%) use Geth, the most popular execution client. This has led to calls for client diversification to reduce the reliance on a single client and mitigate the risk of a single point of failure. Coinbase Cloud, a prominent company, has announced that it is looking into alternative execution clients, while other teams such as Allnodes and P2P have already transitioned to using Besu. The Aave-Chan Initiative has also announced plans to switch its minority EL clients for all its ETH nodes. Despite these efforts, as of today, around 78% of validators still use Geth, indicating a need for further diversification.

title: Ethereum ETF Approval Expected in May, Standard Chartered Says - Bloomberg Law
summary: According to a research report by Standard Chartered Plc, the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is expected to approve exchange-traded funds (ETFs) holding the cryptocurrency Ethereum in May. The SEC has until May 23 to consider ETF applications from VanEck and Ark 21Shares, which would be the first time the agency has ruled on Ethereum-based ETFs. Standard Chartered believes the SEC will follow its previous pattern of approving ETFs on the final deadline, as it did in January when it approved 10 Bitcoin ETFs. The bank notes that Ethereum has similar legal and financial structures to Bitcoin, which could support its approval.

title: StanChart believes SEC will approve Ethereum ETFs in May - CryptoSlate
summary: Standard Chartered Bank has predicted that the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) will approve spot Ethereum exchange-traded funds (ETFs) by May 23, based on the SEC's previous approval process for spot Bitcoin ETFs. According to Geoffrey Kendrick, the head of forex and digital assets research at Standard Chartered, Ethereum has avoided being classified as a security in legal actions against crypto firms, and its presence as a regulated futures contract on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange bolsters the likelihood of approval. Kendrick predicts that Ethereum's price could spike to $4,000 if it follows the same trajectory as Bitcoin leading up to its ETF approval. He also expects initial approvals to focus on simple Ethereum ETFs that track the price movements of ETH, with more complex offerings emerging later. Additionally, Kendrick views Ethereum's upcoming network upgrades, such as Dencun or Proto-Danksharding, as beneficial for price growth.

title: Ethereum’s Dencun upgrade goes live on Sepolia testnet - The Block
summary:
The latest financial news from The Block reports that Ethereum's latest major upgrade, Dencun, has gone live on the Sepolia test network. This upgrade is a significant step towards the anticipated "proto-danksharding" feature, which aims to lower gas fees and improve scalability by introducing a new, compressed data storage mechanism called "blobs."

According to the report, Dencun deployment on Sepolia commenced at 22:51 UTC Tuesday and was finalized soon after. The upgrade's initiation on the third and final testnet, Holesky, is scheduled for Feb. 7. Once all three testnets have successfully deployed the upgrade, the Ethereum team is expected to establish a mainnet launch date for Dencun.

Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin explained in a community explainer that a blob-carrying transaction is like a regular transaction, except it also carries an extra piece of data called a blob. Blobs are extremely large (~125 kB) and can be much cheaper than similar amounts of calldata.

title: Standard Chartered: Ethereum Spot ETFs Likely To Be Approved by May 2024 - Yahoo Finance
summary: Standard Chartered, a British multinational bank, has projected that Ethereum (ETH) exchange-traded funds (ETFs) will be approved by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) by May 23, 2024, and could potentially double the current price of ETH. The bank cites the SEC's lack of classification of ETH as a security, in contrast to the regulator's crackdown on crypto companies selling unregistered securities. Standard Chartered expects the approval of spot ETH ETFs to lead to a surge in the value of ETH, potentially reaching $4,000. The bank has also maintained its bullish outlook on Bitcoin, predicting that BTC could reach $100,000 per coin by the end of 2024.

title: It's now free to connect a real domain to Ethereum Name Service - Domain Name Wire
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the article you provided:

Ethereum Name Service (ENS) has introduced a new feature that allows users to connect their real domain names to the platform for free, without incurring expensive gas fees. The new feature, called "Gasless DNSSEC," enables users to use their own domain names in place of the traditional.eth addresses used by ENS. This is made possible through a new smart contract that eliminates the need for a large amount of DNSSEC proof to be saved on the Ethereum blockchain, allowing DNS records to be verified through an off-chain gateway. As a result, users can now use their real domain names in the ENS ecosystem without paying gas fees. To enable this feature, domain name owners will need to enable DNSSEC and add a TXT record to their domain.

title: Ether Could Hit $4,000 With Likely Spot ETH ETF Approval in May: Standard Chartered - CoinDesk
summary: According to a recent report by Standard Chartered, the approval of a spot ETF for Ether (ETH) is likely to occur in May, with the market currently underestimating the odds of an approval. The bank believes that there is no fundamental reason for the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to treat ETH differently than Bitcoin, highlighting the listing of ETH futures on the regulated Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) and the SEC's lack of inclusion of ETH among the 67 cryptocurrencies it deemed securities in its legal fight against Ripple. The report suggests that these factors could lead to an approval of a spot ETF for ETH, which could potentially drive the price of the cryptocurrency to $4,000.

title: TD Cowen expects spot Ethereum ETF no earlier than 2025 or 2026 - CryptoSlate
summary: TD Cowen, a financial services company, has predicted that the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is unlikely to approve a spot Ethereum ETF before 2025 or 2026. The company cites political factors, including the SEC Chair Gary Gensler's need to maintain support from progressive Democrats, as the reason for their low approval expectations. The SEC must reach a decision on VanEck's spot Ethereum ETF application by May 23, but is not required to approve the fund. Other sources are divided on the likelihood of approval, with some predicting a higher chance of approval and others predicting a lower chance. The political landscape and partisan attitudes towards cryptocurrency are seen as major factors in the SEC's decision-making process.

title: How to Bridge Ethereum (ETH) to Solana? - Watcher Guru
summary:
The article discusses how to bridge Ethereum (ETH) to Solana using the Portal Bridge. The process involves four simple steps:

1. Open Portal Bridge and connect your supported wallet (e.g. MetaMask or Phantom).
2. Select 'Ethereum Mainnet' as the source chain and 'Solana' as the destination chain.
3. Select ETH as the token to be bridged and specify the amount to be transferred.
4. Follow the instructions on your wallet interface to complete the bridge, which should be quick and secure. Fees will be applicable, with fees starting at around $20 for Ethereum and transaction fees of around $0.0001 per transfer using Portal Bridge.

The article also explains the concept of bridging in the cryptocurrency sector, highlighting its importance in allowing assets to move between different networks that may not be compatible. Bridges work by locking assets on the source chain and minting equivalent assets on the destination chain, ensuring the value is maintained throughout the process.

Overall, the article provides a step-by-step guide on how to bridge ETH to Solana using Portal Bridge

title: Ethereum Could Nearly Double in Price on ETF Approval in May: Standard Chartered - Decrypt
summary:
Standard Chartered, a British multinational bank, has predicted that the value of Ethereum (ETH) could nearly double in price by May due to the approval of ETFs giving investors exposure to the cryptocurrency. According to the bank, the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is likely to approve spot ETH ETFs by May 23, which could drive the price of ETH up to $4,000. This is a significant increase from the current price of $2,372, and a high of $4,878 in November 2021.

The bank's prediction is based on the SEC's recent approval of Bitcoin ETFs, which have been successful since their launch. The SEC has not deemed ETH a security, while it has cracked down on crypto companies selling unregistered securities. The Commodities and Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) has also classified ETH as a commodity, which could contribute to its approval as an ETF.

title: TD Cowen Predicts Approval for Spot Ethereum ETF by 2025-2026 - Coinpedia Fintech News
summary: TD Cowen, an investment bank, has revised its forecast for the approval of a spot Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) in the United States, now expecting approval in late 2025 or early 2026, rather than post-November 2024 as previously thought. The delay is attributed to both political factors and the regulatory approach of SEC Chair Gary Gensler, who is said to be cautious in his approach to crypto regulation and desires more experience with recently approved spot Bitcoin ETFs before approving an Ethereum counterpart. The SEC's ability to easily delay or dismiss ETF applications using standard administrative procedures is also a factor, suggesting that final decisions could take several more years unless there's significant outside influence or political considerations.

title: Why Solana Beats Ethereum In This Bull Cycle: Crypto Expert - NewsBTC
summary:
In a recent analysis, Andrew Kang, co-founder and partner of Mechanism Capital, compared the strengths of Solana (SOL) and Ethereum (ETH) in the current cryptocurrency market. Kang argued that Solana presents a more favorable trading option than Ethereum due to several reasons.

Firstly, Kang noted that Ethereum's early volatility and lack of education in the past have led to a hardening of investors' allocation between Ethereum and Bitcoin, resulting in reduced conversion from Bitcoin to Ethereum during risk-on periods. Additionally, the development of Layer 2 solutions and modular technology has introduced new complexities that impact Ethereum's performance in bull markets.

On the other hand, Solana has crossed the chasm in becoming a blue-chip Layer 1 and has appeal to conservative investors who previously focused mainly on Bitcoin and Ethereum. Solana's resilience and lack of baggage make it an attractive investment option. Kang also noted a major shift in market dynamics in 2023, which has redefined

title: Vitalik Buterin Says Developers Should 'Tread Carefully' Mixing Crypto and AI - CoinDesk
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has expressed caution regarding the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) and cryptocurrency. While he is more optimistic than he once was about the potential intersections between AI and crypto, he believes there are challenges to be addressed. Specifically, he notes that the transparency of crypto may not be compatible with the opaqueness of "black box" AI systems. According to Buterin, open-source AI models are more vulnerable to adversarial machine learning attacks, which could compromise the security of crypto transactions. Therefore, developers should "tread carefully" when combining these two fields.

title: Gas-Free Ethereum Games? Animoca Brands and Layer-2 LightLink Team Up - Decrypt
summary: Animoca Brands, a leading publisher of crypto games, and LightLink, a layer-2 scaling protocol for Ethereum, have announced a collaboration to integrate gasless transactions into Animoca's games. Under the agreement, Animoca will look to implement LightLink's technology into selected games while providing guidance on tokenomics and marketing strategy. The partnership aims to make blockchain more accessible and user-friendly by reducing gas fees for Web3 games. LightLink is already being used by over 25 companies and projects, including blockchain-based games Grapes and The Red Village. The collaboration between Animoca and LightLink is expected to foster greater interconnectivity in blockchain-based applications and improve mainstream adoption.

title: Proto-Danksharding Ahoy! Ethereum Upgrade Clears Another Hurdle - Decrypt
summary:
The latest financial news in the cryptocurrency space revolves around the Ethereum network's upcoming upgrade, Dencun, which has successfully cleared another hurdle. Dencun is an important upgrade that introduces "proto-danksharding," a feature designed to reduce transaction costs for layer-2 blockchains, making data availability cheaper while addressing scalability issues.

The upgrade has been activated on the Sepolia testnet and is expected to be implemented on the Holesky testnet on February 7. Once completed, a date will be set for the upgrade's activation on the main Ethereum blockchain.

According to an Ethereum developer, Dencun is an intermediate step towards making Ethereum a truly scalable blockchain. The upgrade also introduces "blobs," which are intended to reduce rollup cost on the Ethereum mainnet by compressing transaction data off-chain, decreasing the storage and processing load.

The Dencun upgrade is a significant development in the cryptocurrency space, as it has the potential to significantly improve the scalability and efficiency of the Ethereum network. With the successful activation on the Se

title: Ethereum’s Dencun Upgrade Goes Live On Sepolia Without A Hitch - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary:
The Ethereum network has successfully deployed the Dencun upgrade on the Sepolia testnet without any issues. This marks the second of three testnet deployments for the highly anticipated upgrade, which aims to significantly improve data availability and reduce fees associated with transacting on Layer 2. The upgrade, also known as proto-danksharding, will replace gas-intensive calldata with blobs, allowing for cheaper data storage and transactions. The final testnet deployment is scheduled for February 7 on the Holesky testnet.

The Dencun upgrade is expected to improve the scalability of the Ethereum network by reducing the cost of storing data on-chain, which is currently the primary bottleneck restricting scalability gains at Layer 2. According to data from GrowThePie, gas fees on leading Layer 2 networks have increased by 50-100% since mid-October, highlighting the need for cheaper transactions.

In an appearance on The Defiant Podcast, Carl Beekhuizen of the Ethereum Foundation explained that the cost of storing data on-chain is the primary bott

title: One Crucial Factor for Ethereum ETF Approval: Bitfinex’s Head of Derivatives - CryptoPotato
summary:
The article discusses the potential approval of an Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) in the United States, highlighting a crucial factor that could influence the Securities and Exchange Commission's (SEC) decision: the classification of Ether as a security or commodity. Jag Kooner, Head of Derivatives at Bitfinex, suggests that the approval of a Bitcoin ETF could impact the SEC's view on an Ethereum ETF, as Ether's classification is a key factor in determining its eligibility for an ETF.

Kooner notes that Ethereum ETFs have emerged in other regions following the launch of the first Bitcoin ETF, particularly in Canada, where regulators were comfortable with the product due to the presence of a regulated futures market for ETH. However, initial attempts by Grayscale and BlackRock to convert their Ethereum trusts into ETFs faced SEC pushback, underscoring the importance of Ether's categorization.

title: TD Cowen: Spot Ethereum ETF Approval Unlikely to Happen in 2024 - Coinspeaker
summary: According to TD Cowen, the approval of a spot Ethereum (ETH) exchange-traded fund (ETF) is unlikely to happen in 2024 due to SEC Chair Gary Gensler's "go-slow" approach. Gensler is reportedly taking a cautious approach due to concerns about fraud and the recent court ruling against the SEC. Additionally, TD Cowen believes that Gensler may be unwilling to upset progressives any further, as he may need their support for any agenda he intends to push this year. The investment bank also suggests that Gensler may want to monitor the performance of spot Bitcoin ETFs before approving ETH products. Over a dozen applicants have submitted proposals for spot ETH ETFs to the SEC, but the Commission has delayed decisions on some of these applications, including Grayscale's and BlackRock's, and has instituted proceedings to gather public comments on the ETF.

title: Ethereum and Polkadot wallet launches a multisig workflow solution - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary: Talisman Wallet, an Ethereum and Polkadot wallet, has launched a private beta for Signet, a multisig workflow solution. Signet is designed to improve organization workflow and enable signers to execute multisig transactions more efficiently. The product is committed to data privacy and will connect with thousands of decentralized applications in the Polkadot ecosystem. The team behind Talisman Wallet has years of experience in streamlining multisig signing, and the product has received positive feedback from the blockchain community. The private beta program aims to encourage interested parties to explore the future of enterprise workflow management and multisig solutions in the blockchain space.

title: Palantir Co-Founder Says One Type of Buyer Could Be Very Important for Bitcoin, Ethereum and Solana - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Palantir co-founder Joe Lonsdale believes that artificial intelligence (AI) agents will play a crucial role in driving demand for cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana. According to Lonsdale, AI agents will likely use these cryptocurrencies to coordinate and trade information, as they expand across various industries. He also believes that if the US government continues to spend money at prolific rates and inflation increases, the prices of these cryptocurrencies could soar.

David Marcus, former president of PayPal and ex-Facebook vice-president, shares a similar view, stating that Bitcoin could become the default neutral, native value exchange asset for AI agents. Marcus believes that AI agents will net settle in real-time on Lightning and convert fiat payouts for a tiny fee.

The article highlights the potential for cryptocurrencies to become an integral part of the expanding AI economy, with AI agents relying on them for coordination and trade. However, it is important to note that the opinions expressed are not investment advice, and investors are advised to do their
